comments:
A) Symptoms or statement of problem (required):
   When we use a wrong parameter to invoke get/setXXXX methods, it will throws
an   unexpected runtime exception.

B) Build on which this problem occurred (required): Eclipse3.0.1

C) Description of steps to reproduce the problem (required):
1. Create a <graph> with a top <DO> which have two properties, ID and name.
2. Invoke do.setString("Order.0","ID001");
3. Invoke do.getString("Order.0");

D) Difference between expected and actual results (required):
   expected: The runtime should throws an IllegalArguementException with a
comment like: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Class 'Order' does not have a
feature named '312321'
   actual:  If the string before the dot is a complex type, it will throws a
ClassCastException without any comment.
            If the string before the dot is a simple type, it will throws a
NullPointerException without any comment.

I can't reproduce this (with EMF 2.1.0).  I either get this exception, if
there's no such feature.

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Class 'Library' does not have a feature
named 'Library'
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.util.SDOUtil.getEStructuralFeature(SDOUtil.java:115)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.util.SDOUtil$Accessor.setFeatureName(SDOUtil.java:832)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.util.SDOUtil$Accessor.process(SDOUtil.java:931)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.util.SDOUtil$Accessor.init(SDOUtil.java:725)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.util.SDOUtil$Accessor.create(SDOUtil.java:645)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.util.SDOUtil.setString(SDOUtil.java:2624)
	at
org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.impl.EDataObjectImpl.setString(EDataObjectImpl.java:538)


Or this if the feature doesn't allow indexing:

java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: Index applies only to multi-valued features.
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.util.SDOUtil$Accessor.setIndex(SDOUtil.java:851)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.util.SDOUtil$Accessor.process(SDOUtil.java:890)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.util.SDOUtil$Accessor.init(SDOUtil.java:725)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.util.SDOUtil$Accessor.create(SDOUtil.java:645)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.util.SDOUtil.setString(SDOUtil.java:2624)
	at
org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.impl.EDataObjectImpl.setString(EDataObjectImpl.java:538)

I don't belive that SDO 1.0 clearly specified all the exception cases, so this
issue should be revisited with the next version of the spec.

traces.message: Class 'Library' does not have a feature named 'Library'
Index applies only to multi-valued features.
